Source code for havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.storage.nvme.vendor.toshiba

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals

import re

from havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.storage.nvme.nvme_drive import NVMeDrive

NON_FB_SMART_DRIVES = ["KXG50ZNV256G TOSHIBA"]



[docs]class Toshiba(NVMeDrive):

    VID = 4473


[docs]    def get_manufacturer(self):
        if self.model in NON_FB_SMART_DRIVES:
            return "Toshiba_generic"
        return "Toshiba"



[docs]    def get_vs_smart_add_log(self):
        log = {}
        cmd = "nvme toshiba vs-smart-add-log /dev/%s" % self.block_name
        out = self.host.run(cmd)
        pattern = r"^(.+)\s*:\s+(.+)"
        """
        Sample output
            Vendor Log Page 0xCA for NVME device:nvme0n1 namespace-id:ffffffff
            Total data written to NAND               : 531241.6 GiB
            Total data read from NAND                : 676680.6 GiB
            Bad NAND Block Count (Normalised)        : 100
            ...
        """
        matches = re.findall(pattern, out, re.MULTILINE)
        for k, v in matches:
            # convert to float if numeric
            log[k] = float(v) if v.isdigit() else v

        return log



[docs]    def get_smart_log(self):
        log = {}

        log.update(super(Toshiba, self).get_smart_log())
        if self.model not in NON_FB_SMART_DRIVES:
            log.update({'vs-smart-add-log': self.get_vs_smart_add_log()})

        return log

        # TODO import when adding get_write_amplification to NVMeDrive from Autotest
        pass

        # TODO: implement when moving bit_error_ratio_test to Autoval
